text: Murray Hone Ball ONZM (26 January 1939 - 12 March 2017) was a New Zealand cartoonist. He became known for his Stanley the Palaeolithic Hero (the longest running cartoon in Punch magazine), Bruce the Barbarian, All the King's Comrades (also in Punch) and the long-running Footrot Flats comic series. In 2002, Ball became an officer of the New Zealand Order of Merit (ONZM) for his services as a cartoonist. Ball was born in Feilding, New Zealand. He studied at Parktown Boys' High School. Ball died on 12 March 2017 in Gisborne, New Zealand from complications of dementia, aged 78. ==References== ==Other websites== * Murray Ball: The man behind Footrot Flats biography *Footrot Flats by Murray Ball, a Facebook fan-site with a huge photographic catelogue of many Footrot Flats or Murray Ball items / merchandise Category:1939 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Cartoonists Category:Officers of the New Zealand Order of Merit Category:Disease-related deaths in New Zealand Category:Deaths from dementia Category:People from North Island
